questions.question_text: Which of the following allows a user to connect to an isolated device on a stand-alone network?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
A jump box, also known as a jump server or jump host, is a network device or virtual machine that provides a secure way to access and manage devices in a separate security zone

questions.question_text: Early in the morning, an administrator installs a new DHCP server. In the afternoon, some users report they are experiencing network outages. Which of the following is the most likely issue?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
A. The administrator did not provision enough IP addresses.

When a new DHCP server is installed, it is responsible for dynamically assigning IP addresses to clients on the network. If the administrator did not provision enough IP addresses (by setting an appropriately sized IP address pool), clients may not be able to obtain IP addresses, leading to network outages or connectivity issues.

choices.B: The administrator configured an incorrect default gateway.
choices.C: The administrator did not provision enough routes.
choices.A: The administrator did not provision enough IP addresses.
choices.D: The administrator did not provision enough MAC addresses.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
Almost went with “A” but while MAC filtering can restrict access based on device MAC addresses, it is less secure than 802.1X because a MAC address can be spoofed. Going with B

Selected Answer: B
802.1X is an IEEE standard that authenticates devices connecting to a network, whether wired or wireless

questions.question_text: A company is implementing a policy that will not allow employees to bring personal devices to the office and connect to the wireless network. Which of the following is the best way to enforce this policy?

A network engineer is troubleshooting an issue with a VoIP network. After performing analysis, the engineer found that when users upload large files, voice quality is severely degraded. When no other traffic is on the network, voice quality is fine. Which of the following should the engineer do to most likely resolve the issue?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
C. Configure QoS on the router.

Explanation:

Quality of Service (QoS) is used to prioritize certain types of traffic over others on a network. In this case, the issue is that voice quality is degraded when users upload large files, likely because file uploads consume a significant amount of bandwidth, causing congestion and affecting the real-time nature of VoIP traffic

questions.question_text: Which of the following disaster recovery metrics is used to describe the amount of data that is lost since the last backup?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
RPO ( Recovery Point Objective ) is the maximum acceptable amount of data loss from a disruptive event to its last backup that a business system can tolerate before causing harm to the organisation.

RPO is different from recovery time objective (RTO), which is the maximum acceptable amount of time that can pass before an organisation restores functionality to an application, service, data, or other digital asset that is inaccessible due to an outage.

Selected Answer: C
C. RPO
The maximum amount of data loss a business can tolerate before it negatively impacts the organization. RPO drives how often a company backs up its data
